title: Atom and agriculture
brief_description: The importance, types and principal uses of radio-active isotopes in agricultural research; radio-active cobalt and calcium used to study growth and hereditary characteristics in plants; radio-active carbon-dioxide used to study the chemistry of food production; radio-sulphur used in the study of wool growth; use of radio-active calcium and phosphorous in research work on egg production. No other credits available.
